meanings.sent1: He gipped his friend by taking his lunch money.
meanings.sent2: She gipped him out of his rightful share of the profits.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox gipped the rabbit out of its carrot.
meanings.sent4: The con artist gipped unsuspecting tourists out of their savings.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest salesman gipped customers with false promises.

meanings.definition: To obtain by cheating or deception
meanings.sent1: The thief gipped the jewels from the museum.
meanings.sent2: She gipped her way into getting a free meal at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The clever magician gipped the audience into believing he could fly.
meanings.sent4: The hacker gipped sensitive information from the company's database.
meanings.sent5: The scammer gipped personal details through a phishing email.

meanings.sent1: He gipped his little sister into giving him her toys.
meanings.sent2: She gipped her classmates into thinking she had aced the test.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun gipped the children into searching for his pot of gold.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox gipped the farmer into leaving the henhouse unguarded.
meanings.sent5: The sly raccoon gipped the campers into sharing their snacks.
